subsc: General transportation sector,Roads and highways,Central government administration

abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Phase of the Road Development
            Program Project aims to improve access to rural areas and
            economically productive areas and to progressively continue
            build up sustainable road sector planning, design, and
            program management capability, as well as road safety
            management. There are six project components: 1) The first
            component will support the upgrading of National roads to
            paved (Bitumen) standard and strengthening of paved roads.
            It involves: Karuma-Pakwach-Arua Road, Section
            Karuma-Olwyio-Pakwach, as well as Katunguru-Kasese-Fort
            Portal, Equator, and Kilembe Roads. 2) The second component
            will finance road safety improvement and audit study action
            plan. Phase I of the Action Plan to be implemented under the
            Phase II project will involve civil works to improve
            accident blackspots on major corridors, and consulting
            services concerning the design and construction supervision
            of such works. 3) The third component will support the
            preparation of a national transport master plan and
            transport master plan for Greater Kampala. 4) The fourth
            component will finance pilot project for demonstration use
            of innovative technologies for construction of low volume
            traffic roads. 5) The fifth component will support
            feasibility study and design of a national road agency
            building. 6) The sixth component will finance consulting
            services for the supervision of civil works.
